Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate and the players had not performed well enough to satisfy the fans, resulting in boos from the stands.
Southgate remained the lightning rod for everything and faced loud jeers and cup throws from the fans after the match.
There were positives for England, including better defending and more intensity, but ultimately it was not enough to secure a win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fans' support was evident throughout the match, especially in the second half.
Slovenia celebrated reaching the last 16 of the tournament.
There were concerns about England's ability to move the ball with any degree of slickness, particularly noted in the first half.
